verses.text: The word that the \sc Lord\sc* spake against Babylon \add and\add* against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.

Declare ye among the nations, and publish, and set up a standard; Publish, \add and\add* conceal not: Say, Babylon is taken, Bel is confounded, Merodach is broken in pieces; Her idols are confounded, her images are broken in pieces.
For out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, Which shall make her land desolate, And none shall dwell therein: They shall remove, they shall depart, both man and beast.

In those days, and in that time, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, The children of Israel shall come, They and the children of Judah together, Going and weeping: they shall go, And seek the \sc Lord\sc* their God.

They shall ask the way \add to\add* Zion with their faces thitherward, \add saying\add*, Come, and let us join ourselves to the \sc Lord\sc* \add In\add* a perpetual covenant \add that\add* shall not be forgotten.

My people hath been lost sheep: Their shepherds have caused them to go astray, they have turned them away \add on\add* the mountains: They have gone from mountain to hill, They have forgotten their resting place.

All that found them have devoured them: And their adversaries said, We offend not, Because they have sinned against the \sc Lord\sc*, the habitation of justice, Even the \sc Lord\sc*, the hope of their fathers.
Remove out of the midst of Babylon, And go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, And be as the he goats before the flocks.

For lo, I \add will\add* raise and cause to come up against Babylon An assembly of great nations from the north country: And they shall set \add themselves\add* in array against her; From thence she shall be taken: Their arrows \add shall be\add* as of a mighty expert \add man;\add* None shall return in vain.
And Chaldea shall be a spoil: All that spoil her shall be satisfied, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Because ye were glad, because ye rejoiced, O ye destroyers of mine heritage, Because ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass, And bellow as bulls;
Your mother shall be sore confounded; She that bare you shall be ashamed: Behold, the hindermost of the nations \add Shall be\add* a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
Because of the wrath of the \sc Lord\sc* it shall not be inhabited, But it shall be wholly desolate: every one that goeth by Babylon shall be astonished, And hiss at all her plagues.
Put \add yourselves\add* in array against Babylon round about: All ye that bend the bow, shoot at her, spare no arrows: For she hath sinned against the \sc Lord\sc*.

Shout against her round about: She hath given her hand: Her foundations are fallen, her walls are thrown down: For it \add is\add* the vengeance of the \sc Lord\sc*: take vengeance upon her; As she hath done, do unto her.

Cut off the sower from Babylon, And him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest; For fear of the oppressing sword They shall turn every one to his people, And they shall flee every one to his own land.
Israel \add is\add* a scattered sheep; The lions have driven \add him\add* away: First the king of Assyria hath devoured him; And last this Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones.
Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I \add will\add* punish the king of Babylon and his land, As I have punished the king of Assyria.
And I will bring Israel again to his habitation, And he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, And his soul shall be satisfied upon mount Ephraim and Gilead.

In those days, and in that time, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, The iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and \add there shall be\add* none; And the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: For I will pardon them whom I reserve.

Go up against the land of Merathaim, \add even\add* against it, And against the inhabitants of Pekod: Waste and utterly destroy after them, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, And do according to all that I have commanded thee.
A sound of battle \add is\add* in the land, And of great destruction.
How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! How is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!
I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, And thou wast not aware: Thou art found, and also caught, Because thou hast striven against the \sc Lord\sc*.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath opened his armoury, And hath brought forth the weapons of his indignation: For this \add is\add* the work of the Lord \sc God\sc* of hosts In the land of the Chaldeans.
Come against her from the utmost border, Open her storehouses: Cast her up as heaps, and destroy her utterly: Let nothing of her be left.
Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: Woe unto them! for their day is come, The time of their visitation.
The voice of them that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, To declare in Zion the vengeance of the \sc Lord\sc* our God, The vengeance of his temple.

Call together the archers against Babylon: All ye that bend the bow, camp against it round about; Let none thereof escape: Recompense her according to her work; According to all that she hath done, do unto her: For she hath been proud against the \sc Lord\sc*, against the Holy One of Israel.
Therefore shall her young men fall in the streets, And all her men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Behold, I \add am\add* against thee, \add O thou\add* most proud, Saith the Lord \sc God\sc* of hosts: For thy day is come, the time \add that\add* I will visit thee.
And the most proud shall stumble and fall, And none shall raise him up: And I will kindle a fire in his cities, And it shall devour all round about him.
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; The children of Israel and the children of Judah \add were\add* oppressed together: And all that took them captives held them fast; They refused to let them go.
Their redeemer \add is\add* strong; The \sc Lord\sc* of hosts \add is\add* his name: He shall throughly plead their cause, That he may give rest to the land, And disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
A sword \add is\add* upon the Chaldeans, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, And upon the inhabitants of Babylon, And upon her princes, and upon her wise \add men\add*.
A sword \add is\add* upon the liars; and they shall dote: A sword \add is\add* upon her mighty \add men;\add* and they shall be dismayed.

A sword \add is\add* upon their horses, and upon their chariots, And upon all the mingled people that \add are\add* in the midst of her; And they shall become as women: A sword \add is\add* upon her treasures; and they shall be robbed.
A drought \add is\add* upon her waters; and they shall be dried up: For it \add is\add* the land of graven images, And they are mad upon \add their\add* idols.

Therefore the wild beasts of the desert With the wild beasts of the islands shall dwell \add there\add*, And the owls shall dwell therein: And it shall be no more inhabited for ever; Neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah And the neighbour \add cities\add* thereof, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; \add So\add* shall no man abide there, Neither shall any son of man dwell therein.
Behold, a people shall come from the north, And a great nation, and many kings Shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.

They shall hold the bow and the lance: They \add are\add* cruel, and will not shew mercy: Their voice shall roar like the sea, And they shall ride upon horses, \add Every one\add* put in array, like a man to the battle, Against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them, And his hands waxed feeble: Anguish took hold of him, \add And\add* pangs as of a woman in travail.

Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan Unto the habitation of the strong: But I will make them suddenly run away from her: And who \add is\add* a chosen \add man, that\add* I may appoint over her? For who \add is\add* like me? and who will appoint me the time? And who \add is\add* that shepherd that will stand before me?

Therefore hear ye the counsel of the \sc Lord\sc*, That he hath taken against Babylon; And his purposes, that he hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: Surely he shall make \add their\add* habitation desolate with them.
At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth is moved, And the cry is heard among the nations.
